title: Water Body Reference Sheet
description: Defines a single water body -- ocean, sea, bay, strait, lake, or river -- including its type, location, connections, myths, and significance. Water bodies are fundamental to settlement placement, trade routes, and naval power.

id.description: Unique identifier for this water body (auto-generated)

name.description: Name of the water body (naming can be based on reputation, events, or characteristics)

location.description: Where this water body is located relative to continents and other features

size.description: Approximate size (miles/km across, length for rivers)

depth.description: General depth characteristics (shallow, moderate, deep trenches) and implications

connected_to.description: Other water bodies this one connects to

continents_bordered.description: Continents that border this water body

settlements_on_shores.description: Major settlements along this water body's shores

sovereign_powers_bordering.description: Sovereign powers that control shores of this water body

reputation.description: What this water body is known for (dangerous crossings, pirate waters, monster sightings, etc.)

myths.description: Myths or legends associated with this water body (Bermuda Triangle-style phenomena, sea monsters)

creatures.description: Notable creatures known to inhabit this water body

trade_significance.description: How important this water body is for trade (major shipping lane, fishing ground, etc.)

tidal_characteristics.description: Tidal behavior specific to this water body

significance.description: Why this water body matters for the world (strategic chokepoint, species origin, historical battle site)

x-cross-references.continent-profile: This water body borders or is part of continents
x-cross-references.settlement-profile: Settlements along this water body are defined in Settlement Profiles
x-cross-references.sovereign-power-profile: Powers controlling shores are defined in Sovereign Power Profiles
x-cross-references.ship-profile: Ships sailing this water body are defined in Ship Profiles
x-cross-references.sea-travel-calculator: Travel times across this water body use the Sea Travel Calculator
